900.name: On The Swift Flowing River
900.description:
As the river exits the city of Midgaard it picks up speed and whisks you
along high banks flanked by the trees of Haon-Dor. As the city fades in
the east, you approach a gloomy forest to the west. The roar of water
fills your ears. Waves crash and foam relentlessly.

901.name: The Riverbank
901.description:
The river is deep, and runs swiftly in an east-west direction. To the
north the river eddies and enters a backwash where a small bank extends
down from a dark, thick stand of trees. It doesn't look particulary
inviting however. The roar of water fills your ears. The depths are dark
and unknowable.

902.name: The Twisty Part Of The River
902.description:
The river twists and turns and nearly tosses you out of your boat. The
water is dark, cold, almost reptilian in sheen. It seems almost alive.
The river runs east and south. Waves crash and foam relentlessly. The
water churns with dangerous currents.

903.name: The Scenic Route
903.description:
The dark forest of Haon-Dor recedes behind to the northeast. The river
continues in a westerly direction toward the river delta, where you can
just make out a large island. The water churns with dangerous currents.
Waves crash and foam relentlessly.

904.name: The Swift River Delta
904.description:
This is the edge of the river delta, where the river empties out on its
way to the sea. The water here is Black. Deep. Dark. Deadly. The tidal
waves sweep you around and around up and down. Spray mists the air
around. The depths are dark and unknowable.

905.name: Near The Rocks
905.description:
You bob up and down in the waves comming dangerously close to some
large, jagged rocks on the eastern shore of an unusual looking island.
There is no way you could possibly land there without getting killed.
The depths are dark and unknowable. Waves crash and foam relentlessly.

906.name: The South River Delta
906.description:
The way leads along a channel in the river delta between the island to
the west and the shore to the south and east. To the south an aging
broken down looking pier juts out from land and toward the west the
channel works it way close to the island as it moves around its southern
tip. Waves crash and foam relentlessly. Spray mists the air around.

907.name: The Pier
907.description:
You float next to a crumbling pier long since neglected. To the west the
water gets sluggish and there are many weeds and some seaweed floating
about. The depths are dark and unknowable. Waves crash and foam
relentlessly.

908.name: Mired In Seaweed
908.description:
The going is rough here. The tide struggles with the normal flow of the
river and here near the edge of the sea there is a large amount of
growth. To the west the channel passes the southern tip of the island
and heads for open waters. Waves crash and foam relentlessly. The depths
are dark and unknowable.

909.name: The Last Stop
909.description:
The delta meets the sea here. To the west you see nothing but ocean on
the horizon. Sea birds squawk noisily at your approach and take flight
from a nearby beach head on the island. It looks as though this could be
the last stop for those heading out to sea. The roar of water fills your
ears. Spray mists the air around.

910.name: The Beach Head
910.description:
This is a secluded looking beach on the southern tip of the island.
There isn't much to see here and there is no way to cross the steep
rocky cliffs that wall in this place. The air is fresh and clean. Tall
grass sways in a gentle breeze.

911.name: The North Channel
911.description:
The river splits as runs up against the island and a navigatble channel
slips off to the north and west. The roar of water fills your ears. The
depths are dark and unknowable.

912.name: The North Channel
912.description:
The river current carries you swiftly westward as the channel begins to
narrow as it squeezes past the north end of the island. The roar of
water fills your ears. The water churns with dangerous currents.

913.name: Near The Isle
913.description:
The area opens just off a small landing on the island that appears to be
nothing more than a short path that leads to the side of a hill. Spray
mists the air around. The depths are dark and unknowable.

914.name: The Lane Of The Lying
914.description:
Bodies lie everywhere. Commoner, peasant, duke, duchess. The Gods will
not hear you call here. Hence they will not answer you. To the south the
path ends at a dark cave entrance. A sign has been posted beside the
entrance. Buildings crowd together on all sides. Vendors and pedestrians
bustle past.

915.name: The First Trial Of Minos
915.description:
Ah... The passage opens in Minos' battlefield playground. Minos loves to
torture his people through these places. He collects the monsters of the
world and puts them here. The sounds of city life echo around. Buildings
crowd together on all sides.

916.name: The Second Trial Of Minos
916.description:
Minos' voice reveberates from the four walls of this room: 'Get some
rest and make sure you're healed. You'll need it for the next monster in
my playground. Or are you strong enough?' To the south is the entrance
to the next challenge of Minos' stronghold. The cobblestones are worn
smooth by countless feet. Buildings crowd together on all sides.

917.name: The Third Trial Of Minos
917.description:
You go inside a red room. Very red. As if the Minos King used them to
disembowel his guests. The path continues eastward. You see blue lights
in that direction. The ceiling hangs low overhead. The air is still and
musty.

918.name: The Fourth Trial Of Minos
918.description:
Minos must be a monster hacking machine. You see a blue light flicker on
and off. A voice crackles, 'WHY ARE YOU HERE!' The walls are rough-hewn
and cold to the touch. The air is still and musty.

919.name: The Fifth Trial Of Minos
919.description:
This is General Woundwort's quarters. Hraka abound. The frayed corpses
of rabbits lie scattered about this hell-hole. The General is not a very
neat person as you can tell. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The air
is still and musty.

920.name: The Sixth Trial Of Minos
920.description:
Dare we surmise how many more rooms Minos has? The paths appear to be
endless. You shudder the sounds of death cries from the east. A loud
voice bellows another warning: 'Leave now or face my wrath!' There is a
crawlway leading upwards at the far end of the room and there is a fresh
breeze comming from there. Dust motes drift in the stale air. The walls
are rough-hewn and cold to the touch.

921.name: The Final Trial Of Minos
921.description:
This is Minos' room. What else did you expect? The room is lavishly
decorated for this bovine king. Everything is so opulent that it makes
your eyes bulge. Survive and reap his fortune! The only exit is a large
oak door in the east wall. The walls are rough-hewn and cold to the
touch. Dust motes drift in the stale air.

east.description: You see a rather large oak door bound with iron and securely locked.

922.name: The Royal Chamber
922.description:
The treasure room of Minos is dark save for your lantern. Hopefully it
has not been looted yet by the many legendary thieves of Midgaard. A
clever looking secret passage leads upward from here. The walls are
rough-hewn and cold to the touch. The air is still and musty.

923.name: Above, On The Beach
923.description:
You sit amongst the rocks above a small beach at the southern end of the
island. You could clamber down easy enough, but getting back up would be
another story. Rocks jut from the grassy slopes. The view stretches for
miles in every direction.

900.name: homba
900.description: Part kestrel, part bear, part wolf.  Parts is parts, and makes an ugly whole.

901.name: swordsman
901.long_desc: The greatest swordsman in the land is standing here with a sneer on his face.

902.name: mummy
902.long_desc: The Mummy of Rabscuttle wanders here, hands aloft, walking towards you.

903.name: lizard
903.description:
This scaly creature looks like it is well adapted to its underground
habitat.  He looks very powerful.

904.name: woundwort
904.long_desc: General Woundwort, the dark demon of Minos, awaits to maul you to shreds.
904.description: He looks vaguely like a rabbit, but sure doesn't act like one.

905.name: franz
905.long_desc: Franz, Minos' henchman, is here ready to pump you up.
905.description:
Franz is no girlie man.  He is very muscular and looks as if he could
squeeze your head like a grapefruit.

906.name: hanz
906.long_desc: Hanz is here flexing his muscles and squeezing grapefruits.
906.description:
Hanz is no girlie man.  He is very muscular and looks as if he could
lift a large dragon.

907.name: minos
907.long_desc: King Minos the Minotaur is ready and waiting to gore you to death.

908.name: turtle
908.long_desc: A large dragon turtle breaks the surface churning the water into huge waves.
908.description: The turtle's shell is the size of a small house and looks as hard as rock.

909.name: hag
909.long_desc: You notice the face of an ugly hag in the sea weeds.
909.description: The sea hag is terribly fightful and has razor sharp teeth.

910.name: merman
910.long_desc: There is a merman swimming here brandishing his trident at you!
910.description: The merman has a powerful tail fin instead of legs.

911.name: crab
911.long_desc: A crusty looking crab is crawling around here searching for food.
911.description: It looks like a crab... what more can be said?

900.name: key
900.room_desc: A heavy golden key lies here.

901.name: shield
901.room_desc: A dark minotaur shield has been left here.

903.name: gauntlets
903.room_desc: A pair of gauntlets made from troll skin lie on the ground.

904.name: ring
904.room_desc: A shining ring of platinum lies here.  It has a tiny inscription.

905.name: flail
905.room_desc: A flail has been carelessly left here.

906.name: coins
906.room_desc: A great, gleaming pile of treasure lies at your feet.

907.name: spear
907.room_desc: A heavy spear has been tossed on the ground here.

908.name: trident
908.room_desc: There is a warrior's trident here.

909.name: boots
909.room_desc: A pair of boots sit here in a puddle of water.
